tit.cmt: 官営模範工場は歴史用語であるため、ローマ字表記を付け加えました。

sen.j: 官営模範工場（かんえいもはんこうじょう）は、明治政府が殖産興業の政策のため、率先して新しい産業を興すべく創設した工場である。
sen.e: Government-run model factories were set up by the Meiji Government for the promotion of industry.
Government-run model factories were set up by the Meiji Government for the promotion of new industries.
sen.cmt: 原文「新しい産業」となっており、かつ官営模範工場は複数の産業分野に対して創設されているのでindustriesと複数形にしました。
sen.e: Government-run model factories were set up by the Meiji Government for the promotion of new industries.

sen.j: 明治維新後、政府は幕府や諸藩の造船所や鉱山などの事業を引き継ぐとともに、工部省などが官営模範工場を新たに開設し、日本の近代化、資本主義化を図った。
sen.e: After Meiji Restoration, the government took over bakufu's and feudal clans' businesses such as dockyards and mines, and Kobusho (the Ministry of Industry) and other institutes established government-run factories to modernize and capitalize Japan.

After Meiji Restoration, the government took over bakufu's (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and feudal clans' businesses such as dockyards and mines, and Kobusho (the Ministry of Industry) and other institutes established government-run factories to modernize Japan and make the transition to capitalism.
sen.cmt: ※bakufuに説明文がなかったため記載しました。※capitalize Japan→make the transition to capitalismに変更しました。
sen.e: After Meiji Restoration, the government took over bakufu's (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and feudal clans' businesses such as dockyards and mines, and Kobusho (the Ministry of Industry) and other institutes established government-run factories to modernize Japan and make the transition to capitalism.

sen.j: 西南戦争後の財政難のため、1880年に「官営工場払下概則」が施行された後に軍需部門を除いて民間に払い下げられたものが多い。
sen.e: Due to economic difficulties after the Seinan War, most factories were sold to private hands after 'General rules for selling government-run factories' came into force in 1880.
Due to financial difficulties after the Seinan War, most factories were sold to private hands after 'General rules for selling government-run factories' came into force in 1880.
sen.cmt: 用語：economic difficulties→finantial difficultiesに変更しました。
sen.e: Due to financial difficulties after the Seinan War, most factories were sold to private hands after 'General rules for selling government-run factories' came into force in 1880.

sen.j: これらは財閥の形成を促すとともに、日本の産業の中核を担う役割を果たした。
sen.e: These factories promoted the formation of Zaibatsu (company syndicate) and became the core of the Japanese Industries.
